explanation: Funds are required to support the ongoing efforts to utilize granular activated carbon filters to filter contaminated water and recover spilled fuel from the RHBFSF; efforts associated with the design and process for permanent closure to include a beneficial reuse study; and project management costs to include increased civilian personnel costs. This effort includes the following activities:

These funds were appropriated for transfer to accounts under the headings ‘Operation and Maintenance’, ‘Procurement’, ‘Research, Development, Test and Evaluation’, and ‘Defense Working Capital Funds’ by section 165(c) of the Continuing Appropriations Act, 2022, and by section 8150 of the Department of Defense Appropriations Act, 2022.
